00051 #if (RETARGET_INT_MODE == 1)
00052 __ALIGN4 static u8 uSerialBuffer[RETARGET_INT_BUFFER_SIZE];
00053 static vu32 uReadIndex;
00054 static vu32 uWriteIndex;
00055 
00056 #define IS_BUFFER_FULL(LEN)        (((uWriteIndex + LEN) >= RETARGET_INT_BUFFER_SIZE) ? ((uWriteIndex + LEN - RETARGET_INT_BUFFER_SIZE) == uReadIndex) : ((uWriteIndex + LEN) == uReadIndex))
00057 #define IS_BUFFER_EMPTY()          (uReadIndex == uWriteIndex)
00058 #define BUFFER_FREE_LEN()          ((uWriteIndex >= uReadIndex) ? (RETARGET_INT_BUFFER_SIZE - uWriteIndex + uReadIndex - 1) : (uReadIndex - uWriteIndex - 1))
00059 
00060 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00061  * @brief UART IRQ handler.
00062  * @retval None
00063  ************************************************************************************************************/
00064 void RETARGET_UART_IRQHandler(void)
00065 {
00066   if (((RETARGET_USART_PORT->SR) & USART_FLAG_TXDE))
00067   {
00068     if (IS_BUFFER_EMPTY())
00069     {
00070       RETARGET_USART_PORT->IER &= ~USART_INT_TXDE;
00071     }
00072     else
00073     {
00074       RETARGET_USART_PORT->DR = uSerialBuffer[uReadIndex++];
00075       if (uReadIndex == RETARGET_INT_BUFFER_SIZE)
00076       {
00077         uReadIndex = 0;
00078       }
00079     }
00080   }
00081 
00082 }
00083 #endif
00084 
00085 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00086  * @brief Put char to USART.
00087  * @param ch: The char put to USART.
00088  * @retval The char put to USART.
00089  ************************************************************************************************************/
00090 u32 SERIAL_PutChar(u32 ch)
00091 {
00092 #if (RETARGET_INT_MODE == 1)
00093 
00094   while (IS_BUFFER_FULL(1));
00095 
00096   uSerialBuffer[uWriteIndex++] = ch;
00097   if (uWriteIndex == RETARGET_INT_BUFFER_SIZE)
00098   {
00099     uWriteIndex = 0;
00100   }
00101   RETARGET_USART_PORT->IER |= USART_INT_TXDE;
00102 
00103 #else
00104 
00105   RETARGET_USART_PORT->DR = (u8)ch;
00106   while ((RETARGET_USART_PORT->SR & USART_FLAG_TXC) == RESET)
00107   {
00108   }
00109 
00110 #endif
00111 
00112   return ch;
00113 }
00114 
00115 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00116  * @brief Get char from USART.
00117  * @retval The char got from USART.
00118  ************************************************************************************************************/
00119 u32 SERIAL_GetChar(void)
00120 {
00121   while (USART_GetFlagStatus(RETARGET_USART_PORT, USART_FLAG_RXDR) == RESET)
00122   {
00123   }
00124   return USART_ReceiveData(RETARGET_USART_PORT);
00125 }
00126 
00127 #endif

00132 /** @defgroup SERIAL_Private_TypesDefinitions Serial private types definitions
00133   * @{
00134   */
00135 typedef struct _VCP_LINE_CODING
00136 {
00137   u32 dwDTERate;      //Bit rate;
00138   u8  bCharFormat;    //Stop bits:
00139                       //0 = 1   Stop bit
00140                       //1 = 1.5 Stop bit
00141                       //2 = 2   Stop bit
00142   u8  bParityType;    //parity:
00143                       //0 = None
00144                       //1 = Odd
00145                       //2 = Even
00146                       //3 = Mark
00147                       //4 = Space
00148   u8  bDataBits;      //Number of data bits (7, 8, 9)
00149 } USBDClass_VCP_LINE_CODING;
00150 /**
00151   * @}
00152   */

00159 #define CLASS_REQ_21_GET_LINE_CODING        (0x21)
00160 #define CLASS_REQ_22_SET_CONTROL_LINE_STATE (0x22)
00161 
00162 #ifndef RETARGET_TXBUFFER_SIZE

00177 #define IS_BUFFER_EMPTY()          (uReadIndex == uWriteIndex)

00240 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00241  * @brief Put char to USB.
00242  * @param ch: The char put to USB.
00243  * @retval The char put to USB.
00244  ************************************************************************************************************/
00245 u32 SERIAL_PutChar(u32 ch)
00246 {
00247   #if (RETARGET_TXBUFFER_SIZE > 63)
00248     #error RETARGET_TXBUFFER_SIZE shall less than 63 (define in ht32fxxxxx_conf.h).
00249   #endif
00250 
00251   #if (RETARGET_USB_MODE == RETARGET_USB_MODE_BLOCK)
00252   while (uDTRState == 0);   /* Wait until user open the virtual COM port by PC UI such as Hyper Terminal    */
00253   #elif (RETARGET_USB_MODE == RETARGET_USB_MODE_NONBLOCK)
00254   if (uDTRState == 0)       /* Drop data if USB or terminal software is not ready                           */
00255   {
00256     return ch;
00257   }
00258   #endif
00259 
00260   TxBuffer[TxCount++] = ch;
00261 
00262   if (TxCount == RETARGET_TXBUFFER_SIZE)
00263   {
00264     TxCount = 0;
00265 
00266     while (gIsINEmpty == FALSE)
00267     {
00268       #if (RETARGET_USB_MODE == RETARGET_USB_MODE_NONBLOCK)
00269       if (uDTRState == 0)
00270       {
00271         return ch;
00272       }
00273       #endif
00274     }
00275 
00276     gIsINEmpty = FALSE;
00277     USBDCore_EPTWriteINData((USBD_EPTn_Enum)RETARGET_TX_EPT, (u32 *)&TxBuffer, RETARGET_TXBUFFER_SIZE);
00278   }
00279 
00280   return ch;
00281 }
00282 
00283 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00284  * @brief Get char from USB.
00285  * @retval The char got from USB.
00286  ************************************************************************************************************/
00287 u32 SERIAL_GetChar(void)
00288 {
00289   u32 value = 0;
00290 
00291   while (IS_BUFFER_EMPTY());
00292   value = uSerialBuffer[uReadIndex++];
00293   if (uReadIndex == RETARGET_BUFFER_SIZE)
00294   {
00295     uReadIndex = 0;
00296   }
00297 
00298   return value;
00299 }
00300 
00301 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00302  * @brief Flush the Tx Buffer
00303  * @retval None
00304  ************************************************************************************************************/
00305 void SERIAL_Flush(void)
00306 {
00307   do
00308   {
00309     #if (RETARGET_USB_MODE == RETARGET_USB_MODE_NONBLOCK)
00310     if (uDTRState == 0)
00311     {
00312       return;
00313     }
00314     #endif
00315   } while (USBDCore_EPTGetTransferCount((USBD_EPTn_Enum)RETARGET_TX_EPT, USBD_TCR_0));
00316 
00317   gIsINEmpty = FALSE;
00318   USBDCore_EPTWriteINData((USBD_EPTn_Enum)RETARGET_TX_EPT, (u32 *)&TxBuffer, TxCount);
00319   TxCount = 0;
00320 }

00322 #ifdef NON_USB_IN_APP

00324 __ALIGN4 USBDCore_TypeDef gUSBCore;
00325 USBD_Driver_TypeDef gUSBDriver;

00327 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00328  * @brief This function handles USB interrupt.
00329  * @retval None
00330  ************************************************************************************************************/
00331 void USB_IRQHandler(void)
00332 {
00333   USBDCore_IRQHandler(&gUSBCore);
00334 }
00335 
00336 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00337  * @brief USB Class initialization.
00338  * @param pClass: pointer of USBDCore_Class_TypeDef
00339  * @retval None
00340  ************************************************************************************************************/
00341 void USBDClass_Init(USBDCore_Class_TypeDef *pClass)
00342 {
00343   pClass->CallBack_ClassRequest = SERIAL_USBDClass_Request;
00344   pClass->CallBack_EPTn[RETARGET_RX_EPT] = SERIAL_USBDClass_RXHandler;
00345   pClass->CallBack_EPTn[RETARGET_TX_EPT] = SERIAL_USBDClass_TXHandler;
00346   return;
00347 }

00349 #if (LIBCFG_CKCU_USB_PLL)
00350 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00351  * @brief  Configure USB PLL
00352  * @retval None
00353  ************************************************************************************************************/
00354 void USBPLL_Configuration(void)
00355 {
00356   if ((HT_CKCU->GCCR & (1 << 11)) == 0)
00357   {
00358     CKCU_HSICmd(ENABLE);
00359   }
00360 
00361   { /* USB PLL configuration                                                                                */
00362 
00363     /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00364        Notice that the local variable (structure) did not have an initial value.
00365        Please confirm that there are no missing members in the parameter settings below in this function.
00366     */
00367     CKCU_PLLInitTypeDef PLLInit;
00368 
00369     PLLInit.ClockSource = CKCU_PLLSRC_HSI;
00370     #if (LIBCFG_CKCU_USB_PLL_96M)
00371     PLLInit.CFG = CKCU_USBPLL_8M_96M;
00372     #else
00373     PLLInit.CFG = CKCU_USBPLL_8M_48M;
00374     #endif
00375     PLLInit.BYPASSCmd = DISABLE;
00376     CKCU_USBPLLInit(&PLLInit);
00377   }
00378 
00379   CKCU_USBPLLCmd(ENABLE);
00380 
00381   while (CKCU_GetClockReadyStatus(CKCU_FLAG_USBPLLRDY) == RESET);
00382   CKCU_USBClockConfig(CKCU_CKUSBPLL);
00383 }
00384 #endif
00385 
00386 #if (LIBCFG_PWRCU_VREG)
00387 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00388  * @brief  Configure USB Voltage
00389  * @retval None
00390  ************************************************************************************************************/
00391 void USBVRG_Configuration(void)
00392 {
00393   CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{ 0 }};
00394   CKCUClock.Bit.BKP = 1;
00395   CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00396 
00397   /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00398      USB LDO should be enabled (PWRCU_VREG_ENABLE) if the MCU VDD > 3.6 V.
00399   */
00400   PWRCU_VREGConfig(PWRCU_VREG_BYPASS);
00401 }
00402 #endif
00403 
00404 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00405  * @brief Configure USB for retarget.
00406  * @retval None
00407  ************************************************************************************************************/
00408 void SERIAL_USBDInit(void)
00409 {
00410   CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{0}};
00411   CKCUClock.Bit.USBD = 1;
00412   CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00413 
00414   #if (LIBCFG_CKCU_USB_PLL)
00415   USBPLL_Configuration();
00416   #endif
00417 
00418   #if (LIBCFG_PWRCU_VREG)
00419   USBVRG_Configuration();                               /* Voltage of USB setting                           */
00420   #endif
00421 
00422   /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00423      Must turn on if the USB clock source is from HSI (PLL clock Source)
00424   */
00425   #if (RETARGET_HSI_ATM)
00426   CKCU_HSIAutoTrimClkConfig(CKCU_ATC_USB);
00427   CKCU_HSIAutoTrimCmd(ENABLE);
00428   #endif
00429 
00430   gUSBCore.pDriver = (u32 *)&gUSBDriver;                /* Initiate memory pointer of USB driver            */
00431   USBDDesc_Init(&gUSBCore.Device.Desc);                 /* Initiate memory pointer of descriptor            */
00432   USBDClass_Init(&gUSBCore.Class);                      /* Initiate USB Class layer                         */
00433   USBDCore_Init(&gUSBCore);                             /* Initiate USB Core layer                          */
00434   NVIC_EnableIRQ(USB_IRQn);                             /* Enable USB device interrupt                      */
00435   USBD_DPpullupCmd(ENABLE);
00436 
00437   #if (RETARGET_USB_MODE == RETARGET_USB_MODE_BLOCK)
00438   USBDCore_MainRoutine(&gUSBCore);                      /* USB core main routine                            */
00439   while (USBDCore_GetStatus() != USB_STATE_CONFIGURED);
00440   #else
00441   gUSBCore.Info.CurrentFeature.Bits.bSelfPowered = TRUE;
00442   USBDCore_MainRoutine(&gUSBCore);                      /* USB core main routine                            */
00443   #endif
00444 }
00445 #endif
00446 
00447 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00448  * @brief USB Device Class Request for USB retarget
00449  * @param pDev: pointer of USB Device
00450  * @retval None
00451  ************************************************************************************************************/
00452 void SERIAL_USBDClass_Request(USBDCore_Device_TypeDef *pDev)
00453 {
00454   u8 USBCmd = *((u8 *)(&(pDev->Request.bRequest)));
00455   u16 len = *((u16 *)(&(pDev->Request.wLength)));
00456   u32 inf = pDev->Request.wIndex;
00457   u32 uIsCmdOK = 0;
00458 
00459   if (inf != 11)
00460   {
00461     return;
00462   }
00463 
00464   if (USBCmd == CLASS_REQ_22_SET_CONTROL_LINE_STATE)
00465   {
00466     if (len == 0)
00467     {
00468       uDTRState = pDev->Request.wValueL & 0x1;
00469       pDev->Transfer.pData = 0;
00470       pDev->Transfer.sByteLength = 0;
00471       pDev->Transfer.Action = USB_ACTION_DATAOUT;
00472     }
00473   }
00474   else
00475   {
00476     if (USBCmd == CLASS_REQ_20_SET_LINE_CODING)
00477     {
00478       pDev->Transfer.Action = USB_ACTION_DATAOUT;
00479       uIsCmdOK = 1;
00480     }
00481     else if (USBCmd == CLASS_REQ_21_GET_LINE_CODING)
00482     {
00483       pDev->Transfer.Action = USB_ACTION_DATAIN;
00484       uIsCmdOK = 1;
00485     }
00486 
00487     if (uIsCmdOK == 1)
00488     {
00489       pDev->Transfer.pData = (uc8*)&USBDClassVCPLineCoding;
00490       pDev->Transfer.sByteLength = (sizeof(USBDClassVCPLineCoding) > pDev->Request.wLength) ? (pDev->Request.wLength) : (sizeof(USBDClassVCPLineCoding));
00491     }
00492   }
00493 
00494   return;
00495 }
00496 
00497 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00498  * @brief USB Class Received handler
00499  * @param EPTn: USB Endpoint number
00500  *   @arg USBD_EPT0 ~ USBD_EPT7
00501  * @retval None
00502 ************************************************************************************************************/
00503 void SERIAL_USBDClass_RXHandler(USBD_EPTn_Enum EPTn)
00504 {
00505   u32 uLen;
00506   u32 uFreeLen = BUFFER_FREE_LEN();
00507   u8 uTempBuffer[64];
00508   u32 i;
00509 
00510   /* Read Receive data                                                                                      */
00511   uLen = USBDCore_EPTReadOUTData(EPTn, (u32*)uTempBuffer, 64);
00512 
00513   if (uLen > uFreeLen)
00514   {
00515     uLen = uFreeLen;
00516   }
00517 
00518   for (i = 0; i < uLen; i++)
00519   {
00520     uSerialBuffer[uWriteIndex++] = uTempBuffer[i];
00521     if (uWriteIndex == RETARGET_BUFFER_SIZE)
00522     {
00523       uWriteIndex = 0;
00524     }
00525   }
00526 
00527   return;
00528 }
00529 
00530 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00531  * @brief USB Class Tx handler
00532  * @param EPTn: USB Endpoint number
00533  *   @arg USBD_EPT0 ~ USBD_EPT7
00534  * @retval None
00535 ************************************************************************************************************/
00536 void SERIAL_USBDClass_TXHandler(USBD_EPTn_Enum EPTn)
00537 {
00538   gIsINEmpty = TRUE;
00539   return;
00540 }
